title: Components of Food
description: Learn about different nutrients, balanced diet, and food components.

questions.question: Which of these is a carbohydrate?
questions.explanation: Rice is a carbohydrate as it is rich in starch, while meat, eggs, and milk are sources of protein.

questions.question: What is the main function of proteins in our body?
questions.explanation: Proteins are essential for building and repairing body tissues, including muscles, skin, and organs.

questions.question: Which vitamin is important for healthy bones?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D helps in the absorption of calcium, which is essential for strong bones.

questions.question: What is a balanced diet?
options: A diet containing all nutrients in right amounts
A diet with only fruits and vegetables
questions.explanation: A balanced diet includes all essential nutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals) in the right proportions.

questions.question: Which of these is a good source of dietary fiber?
questions.explanation: Whole grains are rich in dietary fiber, which helps in digestion and maintaining gut health.

questions.question: What is the main function of carbohydrates?
questions.explanation: Carbohydrates are the body's main source of energy, providing fuel for daily activities.

questions.question: Which mineral is important for healthy blood?
questions.explanation: Iron is essential for making hemoglobin, which carries oxygen in the blood.

questions.question: What is the function of fats in our body?
questions.explanation: Fats provide energy and also help protect vital organs by acting as a cushion.

questions.question: Which of these is a water-soluble vitamin?
questions.explanation: Vitamin B is water-soluble, meaning it dissolves in water and needs to be replenished regularly.

questions.question: What happens if we don't get enough vitamin C?
questions.explanation: Vitamin C deficiency can lead to scurvy, which causes bleeding gums and poor wound healing.
